p: Hydro-distillation of the whole parts of the plants yielded 0.33% of O. stamineus oil and 0.37% of F. deltoidea oil, based on a dry weight. The GC analysis of the oils resulted in identification of 30 and 40 compounds for O. stamineus and F. deltoidea, respectively. The quantitative and qualitative data of the volatile components of both oils are shown in Table 1, in order of elution on a DB-5 type column. Our study showed that O. stamineus oil contained mainly β-caryophyllene (26.31%), bicyclogermacrene (7.7%), methyl eugenol (7.4%), α-humulene (5.06%), α-copaene (2.26%) and naphthalene (1.13), whereas the major constituents of F. deltoidea oil were β-caryophyllene (36.3%), eugenol (8.1%), germacrene D (7.7%), α-humulene (5.5%) and α-copaene (3.3%).
